title: How to get focused consistently - Quora

response.answer_text: There are plenty of views on improving discipline, focus, concentration and dealing with distraction. Arguably, they are all related. I quickly picked up the following questions on Quora and they may be helpful in addition to the answers you receive here: How can we completely concentrate while studying? – 1500+ answers How can I improve my focus? – 660+ How do you keep yourself disciplined? – 600+ How can we control our mind from distraction? – 380+ What are some ways to keep yourself from getting distracted while working or studying? – 270+ What are some tips and tricks to increase concentration power? – 450+ How do you keep yourself focused on your goals? – 340+ How can we control our mind from distraction? – 300+ How do I become more self-disciplined and avoid procrastinating? – 200+ How do I develop razor-sharp focus? How do I improve concentration and increase my productivity? What are proven ways to improve focus? From searching Quora you will find there are quite a few similar or related questions with a varying number of answers. Additionally, an online search will give you many more possibilities. There are plenty of ways to deal with focus, discipline, concentration and distraction because people are different as are the situations they find themselves. There isn’t a widespread consensus on any particular approach being the best for everyone in every circumstance, but approaches can be applied in different situations. As everyone who has struggled with focus, concentration or distraction has done, you will have to find what works for you, whether it is an approach found from answers or something you come up with yourself. This may not be easy as the many different views also indicate. Everyone is searching for the elusive one easy answer for them. They can’t find it out there, they come up an approach that works for them and then let others know about it online. Hence, many different views. Hopefully the above will get you started.

To help you stay inspired, motivated and focused: First and foremost, establish compelling and overarching long-range goals and objectives, covering all the major life dimensions, followed by a game plan, with academic pursuit as your top priority;Next, learn, acquire and practise proven effective study strategies and tactics, SQ5R, Cornell Method, Pomodoro Technique, etc., to help you navigate the academic journey with ease, expediency and efficiency.With a game plan in place, naturally your learning agenda and study guide are factored in.Goals with a game plan in place serve as precise commands to the Reticular Activating System of your brain, just like the servo-mechanism of the Tomahawk cruise missile, homing on to a predetermined, long-distance target. Proven effective study strategies and tactics allow you to make efficient use of your time, so that you are less pressured in doing and completing all the necessary tasks of student life. They help to facilitate your ration of attention and focus. More importantly, you will have more time for pursuing the other important things that matter to you. So you can see, academic mastery is just a matter of strategy and discipline.

You can start keeping a self improvement journal. In this journal you should write down the following daily: Write down your goals: Keeping a journal of your goals reminds you what is currently most important to you.Write what you’re grateful for: Writing what you’re grateful for moves you from scarcity to abundance thinking.Write about emotional events: This can help you more fully experience and understand your emotions.Write key information: By writing down all the outstanding facts of the day you are much more likely to remember them.Write to reduce stress: It is a good habit to reduce physical stressors on your health.The video below provides more information on keeping a self improvement journal.

My secret to stay focused is simple: Dividing the big things in many little things. Lao Tseu said: eIf you want to move a Mountain, say to yourself that is only many little stones to move. Really it works. When I’m not focused on what I really want to achieve, I think about the words of Lao Tseu or often about the rule 20/80, which express this; On a project the most of time people are focused 20% of the time and 80% not at all. I make effort to inverse things and be focused 80%. It works too. But all that is not a secret. Isn't it?
